title: Pench National Park
subtitle: The Land of Mowgli and the Jungle Book
overview: Pench National Park, straddling the borders of Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh, is one of India's premier tiger reserves. It is renowned for its dense teak forests, rich biodiversity, and as the setting that inspired Rudyard Kipling’s ‘The Jungle Book’.
Covering an area of about 758 square kilometers, the Pench Tiger Reserve offers visitors an unforgettable experience of wildlife, adventure, and serenity in nature.

highlights.title: Tiger Reserve
highlights.description: Home to Bengal tigers, leopards, wild dogs, and over 285 bird species — Pench is a wildlife lover’s paradise.

highlights.title: Inspiration for The Jungle Book
highlights.description: The forest described in Rudyard Kipling’s classic tale is said to be based on Pench’s landscapes.

geography.intro: Situated in the southern reaches of the Satpura Hills, Pench National Park lies in Seoni and Chhindwara districts of Madhya Pradesh, extending partly into Maharashtra’s Nagpur district.

details.label: Location
details.value: Nagpur District, Maharashtra, and Seoni District, Madhya Pradesh

details.label: Vegetation
details.value: Dry deciduous forests with teak, mahua, and bamboo

climate.description: Pench experiences a tropical climate with hot summers, pleasant winters, and refreshing monsoon greenery.

seasons.text: Summer (March to June): Warm and dry, great for spotting tigers near water bodies.
Winter (November to February): Pleasant and ideal for safaris.

geography.conclusion: The Pench landscape is a blend of lush forests, tranquil rivers, and diverse wildlife habitats, offering one of Maharashtra’s most immersive forest experiences.

activities.title: Jungle Safari
activities.description: Experience thrilling jeep safaris through the forest trails of Pench with experienced naturalists.
info: Safaris operate from Turia and Sillari gates.
Morning and evening safari slots available.

activities.title: Bird Watching
activities.description: Spot over 285 bird species including Indian roller, crested serpent eagle, and migratory storks.

activities.title: Boat Safari
activities.description: Enjoy boating on the Pench River for a peaceful encounter with aquatic birds and forest views.
info: Available at Khursapar and Sillari zones.

attractions.title: Sillari Gate
attractions.description: Main entry point in Maharashtra for Pench safaris, equipped with eco-tourism facilities.

attractions.title: Pench River
attractions.description: The lifeline of the forest, flowing gently through the park’s heart and supporting diverse flora and fauna.

marineLife.intro: Although Pench is a terrestrial forest, its lakes and rivers support diverse aquatic and amphibian life.

items.title: Aquatic Fauna
items.description: The Pench River hosts several freshwater fish species and supports a balanced ecosystem.

items.title: Amphibians and Reptiles
items.description: The park shelters pythons, cobras, lizards, and a variety of frogs that thrive during the monsoon.

conclusion: Pench’s ecology thrives on the harmonious balance of forest and water systems.
Visitors can explore both forest and aquatic life on a single trip.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport, Nagpur (80 km).
Taxis and tour vehicles available to Pench gates.

howToReach.title: By Rail
details: Good connectivity with Mumbai, Delhi, and major cities.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Regular buses and cabs from Nagpur, Seoni, and Chhindwara.

bookingTips.description: Book jungle safaris online through Maharashtra Forest Department’s official portal.
Carry binoculars, camera lenses, and neutral-colored clothing.
Stay near Sillari or Khursapar gates for best safari access.
